website_summaries.verdict: The Yamaha PRO 300 headphone pair offers a tempered, balanced audio performance for these bass-boosted times, but it could be a lot more comfortable.
pros: Clean, balanced frequency response with no distortion at top volumes
Reproduces deep bass accurately, without serious boosting
Built-in iOS device controls and microphone for calls
cons: Can be quite uncomfortable over long listening sessions, particularly if you wear glasses

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I opened the box the Yamaha Pro 300 headphones came in I was impressed,honestly I thought Apple may have sent me an order by mistake. Amazing quality and then I queued up Us & Them by the Floyd. Gilmour and Wright never sounded so Good,The alto sax was a musical pleasure.these headphones never really distorted and had clear crisp highs and solid base tones. I have tracked this song a thousand plus times and has never sounded this good,highly recommend these quality Headphones you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Skip Esterlein

customer_reviews.title: Miserable to Wear, Broke on 2nd Use
customer_reviews.text: These headphones, while they look nice, are MISERABLE to wear. Even as someone who has a small head, I had a headache within an hour of wearing them. Now, the 2nd time I've actually used them, they're broken at the top of the headpiece. At least now they're tolerable to wear. The volume control doesn't actually work on a Windows computer either. They are nothing short of a waste of money. The box they came in is nice though.
customer_reviews.author: CT_H

customer_reviews.title: plugging this into monitor speakers completely makes it bassless speakers i was scared
customer_reviews.text: I plug it into my phone the bass response is decent. I plug it into my audio interface for monitoring the bass response is great. but when i plug it into my monitor speakers the bass does not respond at all. I at first thought this was some rigged chinese product and i got scammed. but i guess i just cant simply plug it into my speakers to listen to music at home at night. i have to take out the bigger jack and plug it into my audio interface. Is this just my problem or anyone else experience similar symptoms?
customer_reviews.author: Seung Hun Jung

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality was fine, adjustable size fit my head (7 5/8" hat ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on a whim, hoping to spend less than the cost of Beats headphones. Sound quality was fine, adjustable size fit my head (7 5/8" hat size), but the foam ear padding on one came off after six months' use, and I was unable to reattach it. Based on my experience I would recommend just paying more and going with an alternative option.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Look great and are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love the Yamaha Blue racing-look. Very high-quality finish and are very comfortable after wearing them for a couple hours. As far as sound goes I can pick out instruments in different songs that I couldn't before with my cheaper Koss Headphones. I planned on spending more because it was Yamaha brand and the look even though there might be better sounding headphones in the same price range. Love em.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good audio quality tight fit
customer_reviews.text: Overall good headphone. Strong feel not a cheap feel to them. Audio quality is very good. Only beef is they feel tight over the hear if worn for extended time. For example a flight to Paris from the east coast of US and my ears were basically sore by the time we landed. I'm a bigger adult male but not some crazy big guy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound-broken in four months
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Very fragile, beware. Parts kept popping off around the ear and headband numerous times before eventually one ear completely broke. They now adorn my bedroom door handle...fair price on sale but big disappointment. I expect Yamaha to be legacy equipment...not so!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am a Yamaha fan when it comes to headphones, and these worked well. However they are designed for a snug fit, they were uncomfortable after 20 mins of listening time, hurt my ears. I don't have a large head, rather on the small side. So buyer better give it some thought.
customer_reviews.author: JpFlaKeys

customer_reviews.title: Audiophile Sound!
customer_reviews.text: These Yamaha Pro 300 headphones are the real deal. Really just great very well defined sound, with a slight emphasis on the midrange. Compared to say the BOSE Trusound phones, these deliver a much more accurate portrayal of Music as it was made. And as far as comfort goes, I have a big head size 7 3/8 hat, and I find these very comfortable.And played on my iphone 5 they are really loud, you won't need any additional juice unless you want to destroy your hearing. At the price I paid on Amazon for a black pair these are a tremendous value. Just buy them....you'll love them.
customer_reviews.author: James Howard

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like these headphones as they look and sound great and I am a big fan of Yamaha products, however I have to tell it like it is....these headphones hurt! I can only wear them for about 45 minutes before I start experiencing pain in my ear and skull surrounding my ear. The design seems flawed with the curvature too pronounced resulting in far too tight of a squeeze. I have an average size head so I can't blame it on a big melon. Currently perusing Amazon looking for their replacement.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: good sound
customer_reviews.text: Amazon did a good service on the packing department. As for yamaha pro 300 headphones sound quality no argument they are one of the top notch in their class. As for fitting around your head that is fine but the headphones pressing on your ears this thing can be quite painful after 20mins or so of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Seelan K

customer_reviews.title: TLN in Dallas, Texas
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend these. Sound quality is excellent. Clear highs and accurate bass finished with crispness in sound. Due to the on-ear style, they do not block a lot of outside noise, but when listening to them in a quiet environment, they are awesome. The 300s blow the popular "Beats" line away. If you buy them, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: TNudd

customer_reviews.title: agh.... my ear....!!!!
customer_reviews.text: i wanted to like it but aaaagggghhh.. my ear.... sounds slightly better than my iPhone earphone. hurt my ear just after 1/2 an hour. it feels small too..
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah Nurhasan

customer_reviews.title: good sound...tight fit.
customer_reviews.text: wonderful sound but small fit for larger listeners. i have a larger head...usually need a size large fitted ballcap and these were a bit uncomfortable after 20-30 minutes of listening. they are built great with wonderful sound but its just a small tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Derryk B.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones- just not the best
customer_reviews.text: Pro: good sound quality, reasonable noise blocking for on ear and non canceling headphones, obvious attention to materials and construction, stylish design, packaging and case are Apple style Con: a little snug for bigger heads, sound quality is good but not the best in the price range
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Yahama PRO 300
customer_reviews.text: High Fidelity o ear headphones (racing blue) I purchased for my grand daughter for Christmas She is more than pleased said they are really great
customer_reviews.author: charley

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, tight fit.
customer_reviews.text: Sound good, no complaint there. The headset is a tight fit, I finally had to pull it out all the way in order to make it fit better, but then it broke apart. I am holding it together with strong tape in order to use it, but of course it has lost it's sleek look. I would not buy another one unless the company re-designs the headset. I would say that I have an average-size head.
customer_reviews.author: CAREY A. BUNKER

customer_reviews.title: Very clear sound, too tight too ears
customer_reviews.text: Good product, very clear sound, but too tight for ears.
customer_reviews.author: laimis kraujelis

customer_reviews.title: good sound but they are very tight on my head
customer_reviews.text: good sound but they are very tight on my head. Ended up returning them for a more comfortable pair.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: not durable not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These headphones may have good sound to start out with but the audio pin will need to be adjusted after they have been used for some time. When I was listening to the headphones, I would always have to move the pin a certain direction for it to play. These headphones also cannot be worn for more than an hour and a half. You will lose circulation in your ears. Another problem is that the over the head band has been slightly cracked on both sides. I would not recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Bookhound

customer_reviews.title: kick ass
customer_reviews.text: they sound great, best sounding headphones i ever owned. I wear glasses, and the headphones fit tight, causing my ears to ache after about a half hour of use, but they sound so good i can deal with achy ears.
customer_reviews.author: Huckelbuck

customer_reviews.title: Good sound
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my piano sounds clear and the phone feature is handy when used with my Droid.Blocks some noise which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't need headphones that completely cover the ears and I've always disliked ear buds. These fit nicely on my ear without all the bulk from noise blocking headphones or the discomfort that ear buds cause. Yamaha has outdone themselves again: excellent audio quality, impeccable style, and indestructible construction. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really great sound but hurts my head after about 20 minutes. Very tight.
customer_reviews.author: Denise L

customer_reviews.title: Sounds quality is great but it's extremely uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Sounds quality is great but it's extremely uncomfortable. Hoping that the springs will loosen with time. Can't wear them for more than 30minutes without the pressure being a bit painful
customer_reviews.author: Jongchan Park

customer_reviews.title: Tight but Right
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as per description. Feels very tight over my head. Will be 5 stars if it's more comfortable. Sound quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Thadstan

customer_reviews.title: too tight
customer_reviews.text: It's too tight, need several days to make it fit, even so, still cant wear it more than 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Zhiyuan ma

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Head Crushers
customer_reviews.text: Average sound i guess, the build quality seems good but these are the most uncomfortable headphones ive ever bought, they crush your ears and cause fatigue within minutes, nice carrying pouch though
customer_reviews.author: Zander Kane

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and too tight
customer_reviews.text: The sound is pretty good, it looks snazzy, and it's optimal for listening to music on mp3/ipods because it doesn't drain the battery life. However, it is EXTREMELY tight. I'm a very petite (5'2") but it still squeezes my head so hard I cannot wear it for more than a hour without removing it. All reviews for this product agree on the tightness. Given the high price, I would not recommend buying this, especially if you wear glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Jiang

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding and stunning!
customer_reviews.text: The packaging of this is breathe-taking and outstanding, the sound is ear-rocking and stunning! Glad to choose Amazon.cn! You won't regret!
customer_reviews.author: Marble Hu

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: Little too tight but nice looking. Top quality. Super. Nicely designed jack and cord. Good for phone use too. Volume control handy.
customer_reviews.author: FlyingPig

customer_reviews.title: Not for average size head
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good. But the earphones fit too tightly, after 20 minutes my ears start to hurt. I don't have a large head. I had my teenage children try it and they say the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: SmilinL

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good sound but they have too much pressure on the ears.
customer_reviews.author: Owen W. Lafferty

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and great quality. I purchased these to listen to music while mowing the grass. They fit nicely around your ear to keep unwanted noise out while listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha is the best
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time with Beats by Dre which regularly break. Get these and enjoy superior sound and build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good set.Unobtrusive,not too flashy,great for portable use,I like listening to classical music on an ipad while reading books and for this they are perfect.Very clean,natural sound.Nice case.
customer_reviews.author: Blonde girl in wedges

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for about three weeks now and I've been enjoying the ever loving heck out of them. I must admit I got them because they were made by Yamaha. I wanted Yamaha headphones, because I inherited a Yamaha CA-810 Natural Sound Stereo Amp and a Yamaha CT-800 Natural Sound Tuner from my Dad, so I wanted to stay with the brand and I'm glad I did. I'm a girl who loves her music and these headphones really deliver, deep rich bass, midtones which seem right up front and trebles as clear as water. If you're looking for wonderful, clear, crisp sound in a pair of gorgeous looking headphones, these are them.
customer_reviews.author: V. Irene Vega

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not worth the price...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are nice, but if you're looking for hard-hitting bass in these headphones, you'll be sadly mistaken. Top of the line quality, but something that I would get for easy listening, not something that I would to jam out with. Bottom line, though, very good for easy listening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Yamaha PRO 300 High-Fidelity On-Ear Headphones (Piano Black)
feature_bullets: Combines the finest materials with legendary Yamaha tuning know-how to deliver a superb listening experience
Ear cushions are extraordinarily soft and smooth, with a feel so natural you will never want to take them off
Offers an in-line remote/microphone on the 4-foot cable that is optimized for use with Apple devices
PRO Series cables are flat, tangle-resistant and made from a material that is both durable and designed to reduce touch noise transfer effects
Gorgeous geometry and ultra-clean design curves are matched with premium color and finish materials, then emblazoned boldly with the Yamaha iconic tuning-fork marque

specifications.Customer reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
